projectWebShop.controller

Class ShopFacade

  • java.lang.Object
    • projectWebShop.controller.ShopFacade

  • public class ShopFacade
extends java.lang.Object
    The backing bean. All requests from the user interface goes through here.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      ShopFacade()

        public ShopFacade()

    • Method Detail

      • login

        public Users login(java.lang.String username,
                   java.lang.String password)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Searches the Users table in the database database for a user corresponing to the specified username on log in.
        Parameters:
        username - the username typed in by the user on log in.
        password - the password typed in by the user on log in.
        Returns:
        the entity found in the database corresponding to the username.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if no matching user could be found in the database or the password doesn't match.

      • checkBlock

        public boolean checkBlock(java.lang.String username)
        Checks if the user with the specified username is blocked or not by getting the corresponding blocked-column from the Users table in the database on log in.
        Parameters:
        username - the username typed in by the user on log in.
        Returns:
        the value from the corresponding blocked column, e.g. true or false.

      • register

        public Users register(java.lang.String username,
                      java.lang.String password)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Registers a new user in the system by creating a new entity and saving it in the Users table in the database.
        Parameters:
        username - the username typed in by the user when registering.
        password - the password typed in by the user when registering
        Returns:
        the persisted entity, e.g. the newly registered user
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if a user with the specified username already exists

      • browse

        public java.util.List<Inventory> browse()
        Collects all rows from the Inventory table in the databse and inserts them into a list.
        Returns:
        the list containing all rows collected from the database.

      • putInCart

        public java.util.List<Inventory> putInCart(Inventory item,
                                           int amountToCart)
        Creates a new item to put in the shopping cart. Adds the new item to the shopping cart list. Also calls the calc Sum method to calculate the total sum in the shopping cart.
        Parameters:
        item - the item to put in the shopping cart
        amountToCart - the amount of the specified item to put in the shopping cart
        Returns:
        the list containing the items in the shopping cart

      • getSum

        public double getSum()
        Gets the sum of all the items in the shopping cart
        Returns:
        the sum of the items in the shopping cart

      • getRemaining

        public int getRemaining(Inventory item)
        Finds the item in the Inventory table in the database corresponding to the specified item name to get the amount left in stock.
        Parameters:
        item - the item to put in the shopping cart.
        Returns:
        the amount of the specified item left in the database

      • buy

        public java.util.List<Inventory> buy()
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Loops through the list containing the items in the shopping cart and gets each corresponding item from the Inventory table in the database. Removes the item from the database if the amount to buy equals the amount left in stock, otherwise decreases the amount left in stock with the amount to buy. Resets the sum in the shopping cart to zero and the shopping cart list to null.
        Returns:
        the shopping cart list reset to null
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the shopping cart list is empty

      • showUsers

        public java.util.List<Users> showUsers()
        Collects all rows from the Users table in the database in a list. For each collected user in the list, if not contained in the list over registered users adds it to that list.
        Returns:
        the list containing all registered users.

      • blockOrUnblock

        public boolean blockOrUnblock(java.lang.String name)
        Finds the specified user in the database and sets the value of the blocked-variable for that user to the opposite of the current value, either true or false.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the user to be blocked or unblocked
        Returns:
        true if user got blocked, false if unblocked

      • refillStock

        public void refillStock(java.lang.String itemName,
                        int amountToRefill)
        Finds the specified item in the database and gets the current amount left in stock. The method calcAmount is then called to calculate the new amount and it is updated in the database.
        Parameters:
        itemName - the name of the item which is to be re-stocked
        amountToRefill - the amount to add to the current stock

      • addNewItem

        public boolean addNewItem(java.lang.String itemName,
                          double price,
                          int amount)
        Creates a new item to be added to the Inventory table in the database. Adds the item to the table if another item with the same item name is not already present in the database.
        Parameters:
        itemName - the name of the new item to be added to the database
        price - the price of the item
        amount - the amount to be put in stock
        Returns:
        true if the item was added, false if the item is already present in the database

      • remove

        public void remove(java.lang.String item)
        Finds the specified item in the database and removes it. Also removes it from the list containing all items in stock.
        Parameters:
        item - the name of the item to be removed
